Dialogue.NPCText:
Sergio Dumar greets you with a broad smile, his eyes always scanning the crowd.

“Welcome, friend! Thirsty, or simply in search of gossip? In Sunreach, a clever ear and a finer palate are worth their weight in gold—sometimes more.”
His hand lingers on a crystal decanter. “But between us, perhaps you seek a… special vintage?”

Option.text: I’m interested in your special vintages.
Any news from the Five Houses?
You seem to know everyone in Sunreach.
Tell me more about yourself, Sergio.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Sergio’s grin widens; there’s a subtle threat beneath the charm.

“Discerning! For a select few, I offer bottles with… unique properties. Magistrate Thornwall swears by my midnight reserve—cures what ails and silences what talks too much, eh?”

He lowers his voice: “I have a problem, friend. A rival vintner is blackmailing me with rumors of my ‘special’ blends. I’d reward someone willing to… ensure their silence. Interested?”

Option.text: What exactly do you need done?
Poison? Are you confessing to a crime?
Maybe I’ll just try your normal wine.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Sergio’s eyes flicker dangerously.

“Nothing so crude as murder. I want you to find the evidence my rival—Vittorio Salvi—claims to have. Letters, recipes, samples—destroy them, and his leverage vanishes. If you wish to teach him a lesson, I won’t stop you. Discretion, of course, is vital.”
He slides a velvet pouch toward you. “You’ll find Salvi in the merchant quarter. Succeed, and a cask of my finest—and perhaps more—awaits.”

Option.text: What do I do with the evidence once I find it?
Suppose I want to negotiate with your rival instead?
This is too risky for me.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Sergio claps you on the shoulder, jovial once more.

“Excellent! Return when the matter is… corked. And take care—Vittorio’s not above hiring brutes to protect his secrets.”

(You received a quest: Find and destroy the evidence of Sergio’s poisons held by Vittorio Salvi in the merchant quarter.)

Option.text: I’ll be back when it’s done.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Burn it, drown it, bring it here for a bonus—whatever ensures it never sees the light of day. If you do bring it to me, I’ll see you’re well rewarded… and not mentioned to anyone, you understand.”

Sergio shrugs, swirling a glass. “You’re bold—or foolish. If you can make Vittorio drop his accusations, I’ll pay you just as well. But betray me, and I promise: you’ll taste my reserve for the last time.”

Option.text: I’ll see what I can do.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Sergio leans close, breath heavy with wine.
“Crime is such a harsh word. In Sunreach, we call it… advantage. Poison is merely a tool. The real crime is letting rivals get the better of you, yes?”

He straightens, smiling. “If you’re not interested, there’s always wine to drink and gossip to share.”

Option.text: I’ll try your special work, after all.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“A safe choice, though a dull one. Still, I have a new import from Qasaria—smooth as a midnight breeze. Care for a glass?”

(You share a drink. The warmth is real—at least, this time.)

Option.text: Tell me about the city council.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Sergio leans in, voice conspiratorial.

“Ah, the council! Five houses, a thousand secrets. Darius Veynar grows fat on his own ambition; Lady Seraphine stirs trouble in every port. Myself? I simply serve a good drink and a better rumor.”
He winks. “If you ever want to hear what really goes on beneath the city, you know where to find me.”

Option.text: Any news of Minax in Sunreach?
How do you know so much?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Sergio’s smile fades slightly.

“Minax’s shadow falls everywhere, but her agents prefer poison over blades—my kind of company, in some ways. She pays well, but trust me: her gifts always come with a hidden cost. I stick to my business and keep my enemies close, eh?”
He pours another glass. “Let’s toast to your health—while it lasts.”

Option.text: Back to business. About your rival...

Dialogue.NPCText:
Sergio laughs, his mood lightening.

“In Sunreach, knowledge is poured by the glass. Every ship’s captain, every councilman, every hungry beggar comes through my door. A little wine, a little gold, and secrets flow. Lady Seraphine herself uses my cellar for her private meetings—though what’s said there, stays there.”
He gives you a meaningful look. “And you, my friend—what secrets do you keep?”

Option.text: Maybe I’ll share them… for the right price.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Sergio pours himself a measure of amber wine and raises an eyebrow.

“Curiosity—now that’s the best vintage. Very well. But remember, friend… stories have tannins, too. Bitter ones.”
He swirls the glass. “What shall I reveal to you?”

Option.text: How did you become a vintner in Sunreach?
You sound like someone who’s seen blood as well as grapes.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Once, long ago, I was meant for the priesthood.”
He snorts. “I studied with monks near Skara Brae. But I discovered I preferred fermented sin to dry scripture.”

“When I came to Sunreach, I sold sacramental wine to pirates and prophets alike. The city drank, and I listened.”
A brief smile. “And now they toast to Sergio, not the gods.”

Option.text: Do you miss that old life?
I don’t trust men who hide behind wine and robes.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“No regrets, my friend. Wine teaches you that everything changes. Some grapes rot. Some ripen. And some ferment into truth.”
He lifts his glass in silent toast.

Sergio’s eyes harden slightly.
“You’ll find few saints in Sunreach. If I seem charming, it’s because charm keeps knives out of your ribs.”
A sip. “You think I hide? I say I survive.”

He chuckles darkly. “Ah, so you’ve heard the whispers.”

“There was once a noble who insulted Lady Seraphine. The next day, he drank himself to death—on a bottle I supplied. Total accident, of course.”
His grin sharpens. “But it earned me her favor. And now… well, let’s just say I cater to clients with very specific tastes.”

“Not officially.” He winks.

“Every wine has a bouquet, a balance… and an aftertaste. Sometimes, that aftertaste is silence. But I never serve such vintages unless paid in advance.”

Option.text: Do you enjoy it? The power?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Sergio leans close.

“Enjoy? No. But I respect it. There’s truth in poison, friend. It reveals who your enemies are—and who deserves your loyalty.”

“In this city, even the water’s for sale. Better to sell wine… and own your sins.”

“Lady Seraphine sees value in loyalty—and discretion. I offer both.”
He tilts his head. “And perhaps one day, I’ll offer you the same. If you prove you’re not just another thirsty fool.”

A strange softness touches his expression.

“There was someone. A healer, long ago. She hated my friends, my wine, my city. So I let her go.”
He raises his glass. “To love—too strong to drink, too delicate to keep.”

Option.text: Do you still think of her?

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Only when the wine tastes like regret.”
He swirls his glass again. “But that’s enough sentiment. You’ll ruin my reputation.”

Option.text: I like hearing the real you.
Option.action: SendMessage:He looks at you with unexpected warmth.
SendMessage:He raises his glass toward you in silent camaraderie.
